New Records: Pakistan gunned down 345 to win back-to-back games, the highest successful chase ever in a World Cup
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan scored 131* (121), his career-best effort, and Abdullah Shafique scored 113 (103), his career-best effort
Pakistan successfully chased 345, the highest successful chase in a World Cup
Sri Lanka's bowlers were unable to defend 344/9
Pakistan's middle order stepped up to help the team win
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka's captain Kusal Shanaka mentioned that Mendis is in form and Sadeera has been playing well, but they were 20-25 runs short due to the wicket and extra runs
Pakistan's captain Babar Azam decided to play Abdullah Shafique in place of Fakhar Zaman
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Rizwan mentioned that it was a difficult chase, but the team had the belief they could do it
Kusal Shanaka mentioned that they should have finished stronger and given too many extras
Babar Azam praised Rizwan and Shafique for their partnership and the middle order for stepping up
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Uppal, Hyderabad
Pakistan won the match by 6 wickets with 10 balls remaining
The match was a part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24
